author: T Madhavan
text:
The victim, Abinandana, and her brother were staying with their grandparents in Vandalur

A 21-year-old woman died and three of her family members sustained burn injuries in a fire that erupted due to a gas leak from an LPG cylinder at a house in Singarathottam 8{+t}{+h}Street near Vandalur on Wednesday morning. One of the injured is said to be in a critical condition.

The victim was identified as B. Abinandana (21). Her brother B. Hariharan (19) and grandparents G. Elumalai (68) and Shanta (64), who were living with her, were also injured in the accident.

“The young woman had 90 per cent burns. The young man’s burns are 50 per cent, mostly on his back, but they are deep burns. He is in a critical condition,” said Nirmala Ponnambalam, head of the burns and plastic surgery department at Government Kilpauk Medical College Hospital (KMC), where the three injured are undergoing treatment. The grandparents had also suffered burns, but not as badly as the youngsters.

It was believed that Shanta had not closed the valve of the gas cylinder before retiring to bed on Tuesday night. Without realising there was a gas leak, Abinandana, who woke up first, switched on a light in the kitchen, which could have sparked a fire that engulfed her first. Her grandparents and Hariharan, who went to her rescue, were also injured.

Personnel from the Fire and Rescue Services and police from Otteri police station rushed to the spot and took the injured to the hospital.

One of the victims has 90 per cent burns and the other suffered 50 per cent burns
title: One dies, three injured in gas cylinder fire
